meanings.definition: Occurring in turn; succeeding each other in a regular sequence.
meanings.sent1: The altern colors of the traffic lights help drivers know when to stop or go.
meanings.sent2: The altern days of the week are Monday, Wednesday, and Friday.
meanings.sent3: The altern pattern on the wallpaper made the room look like a fun circus tent.
meanings.sent4: The altern sounds of the birds chirping and the wind rustling created a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The altern flavors of the ice cream cone delighted my taste buds.

meanings.sent1: The siblings would altern playing with the toy car in the park.
meanings.sent2: They decided to altern driving on the road trip to share the journey equally.
meanings.sent3: The friends would altern telling jokes to keep the conversation lively.
meanings.sent4: The dancers would altern leading the group in the synchronized routine.
meanings.sent5: The students would altern answering questions during the quiz to involve everyone.
